summary:
• A sanctuary in Australia has stopped allowing visitors to hug koalas due to concerns about their welfare.
• The decision was made after some people expressed concerns that hugging the animals could be harmful or stressful.
• As a result, the sanctuary is now focused on providing a safe and natural environment for its koalas.

• "Australia rejects disabled migrants, tells them they're not welcome."
• "Canada has become the world's largest car theft hub due to lax laws and lenient sentences."
• "Lack of enforcement and strict penalties have contributed to Canada's high car theft rate."

• Copenhagen offers rewards to tourists who participate in cleaning up litter.
• Tourists can enjoy free coffee as part of Copenhagen's sustainability efforts.

• French President Emmanuel Macron has asked Prime Minister Édouard Philippe to remain in his position amid ongoing political deadlock.
• The far-right party saw its expected surge in popularity unexpectedly halted during the recent elections, while the left surged forward.
• Following the elections, a left-leaning alliance won the majority of votes with moderate and socialist candidates holding significant positions.

• Justin Bieber performed at a high-profile wedding in India.
• Several Indian wrestlers are aiming to participate in the upcoming Olympic Games.
• A sexual harassment scandal has affected Indian wrestling, leading to repercussions for some athletes.

• Reformist candidate wins Iran's presidential election
• New president seeks to improve relations with Western countries
• President-elect aims for increased diplomatic engagement with the West

• Israeli forces launch airstrikes on Gaza City amid renewed tank presence in central areas.
• Thousands of civilians flee due to escalating violence in Gaza City.
• The ICC charges Israeli officials with war crimes related to humanitarian crisis in Gaza.

• The President of Liberia has cut their own salary by 40%.
• This move aims to address economic hardship faced by ordinary citizens.
• By taking this step, the president demonstrates commitment to helping those struggling financially.

• A South African football star was held up at gunpoint.
• The incident occurred while he was in South Africa.
• No further details were provided about the event.

• A children's hospital was hit by Russian strikes in Ukraine, killing dozens.
• The staff worked to clear rubble from a destroyed Kyiv hospital.
• A Russian missile attack killed 37 people in Ukraine and damaged a children's hospital.
• Ukrainian attacks on supply lines slowed down the Russian advance in Kharkiv.

• New UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer meets the King.
• He gives a speech.
• He starts working.

• The White House defended Joe Biden's health during a heated press conference.
• A massive wildfire swept through California, forcing an airport to evacuate.
• Hurricane Beryl struck Texas, killing two people and leaving millions without power.
